intro: Anchusa licopsipula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Anchusa licopsipula is adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a resilient species in arid conditions.
